snippet: California has fined a Kaiser Permanente health plan $1 million in the case of a 74-year-old woman who had to wait hours for treatment of a ruptured aortic aneurysm, which led to her death.    The action against Kaiser, California's biggest health...
lead_paragraph: California has fined a Kaiser Permanente health plan $1 million in the case of a 74-year-old woman who had to wait hours for treatment of a ruptured aortic aneurysm, which led to her death. The action against Kaiser, California's biggest health insurer and one of the nation's largest nonprofit health maintenance organizations, follows an investigation into the death of the woman, Margaret Utterback, who died after being kept waiting for treatment at Kaiser's hospital in Hayward, Calif.
abstract: California Department of Corporations has fined Kaiser Permanente health plan $1 million in case of Margaret Utterback, 74-year-old woman who had to wait hours for treatment of ruptured aortic aneursym, which led to her death in 1996; action against Kaiser, California's biggest health insurer, follows probe into woman's death; Utterback was seeking treatment at Kaiser's Hayward facility (S)

headline.main: Kaiser Plan Is Fined $1 Million in Death
